ground_truth: A dark shape, growing and coming down fast, appears in the reflection as a dark figure in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement, hands out to slow the impact. After a moment, he climbs to his feet, recovering from what seems to have been quite a fall. He has chiseled features, a shaved head, and deep-set eyes. He quickly checks his surroundings, seeing nothing but brick walls above him. Then the rain starts to hammer down, and Michael pulls his overcoat tight around his body, dashing toward the mouth of the alley. He reaches the street just in time to see a fleet of police cars tearing around the corner, sirens wailing, heading his way. He runs his finger along its edge. Michael begins to peel off his overcoat, revealing his bare chest underneath, which is covered with dark tattoos. As his coat falls to the ground, we drift over to the brick wall behind him where we see Michael's shadow crouch over. The rain pounds harder, seemingly as punishment from the heavens. The glint of a knife comes down fast, and then silence. Michael, his face tight with pain, puts his trench coat back on, steps out of the alley, and stares with determination at a dark storefront across the street. SMASH! Michael drops down through one of the skylights in a shower of glass and bursts in. He tosses a first-aid kit into the sink, then his trench coat falls to the floor; under the fluorescent light, we get a better look at him. He turns his back to the mirror, revealing two horrifically open wounds running between both shoulder blades. He threads a needle, not with thread but with fishing wire, and begins to stitch the wounds closed as blood pools on the cement floor around his feet. Trench coat and shirt back on, Michael races along endless racks of guns, searching for just the right weapons, his every movement precise as if he's trained his whole life for this. Weapon after ferocious weapon gets tossed into rifle bags. Rifle bags filled, Michael heads for the exit. The place is locked up tight, with a metal gate over the front doors and bars over the windows. Two cops, world weary, cruise through downtown. Burton stares out at the city's rain-soaked denizens with a deep hatred for the shadows looming in doorways and the streetwalkers. He holds his finger up like a pistol, aiming it at the people they pass, picking them off one by one. In the distance, the pop-pop of gunfire is heard. The police radio crackles with urgent chatter and many voices talking at once as Michael lets the gun bags hit the ground. Slowly, Michael places his palms on his skull.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A dark form, expanding and descending swiftly, emerges in the mirror image as a dark figure in a ragged trench coat plunges onto the sidewalk, hands out to lessen the impact. After a moment, he rises to his feet, recuperating from what seems to have been quite a plunge. He has sculpted features, a bald head, and deep-set eyes. He quickly surveys his environment, observing nothing but brick walls above him. Then the rain starts to pummel down, and Michael pulls his overcoat snug around his body, sprinting toward the entrance of the alley. He reaches the road just in time to see a fleet of police vehicles racing around the corner, sirens wailing, heading his way. He runs his finger along its edge. Michael begins to peel off his overcoat, revealing his bare torso underneath, which is adorned with dark tattoos. As his coat descends to the ground, we drift over to the brick wall behind him where we see Michael's shadow crouch over. The rain pounds harder, seemingly as punishment from the heavens. The glint of a dagger descends quickly, and then stillness. Michael, his face tight with agony, puts his trench coat back on, steps out of the alley, and gazes with determination at a shadowy storefront across the road. SMASH! Michael drops down through one of the skylights in a shower of glass and bursts in. He throws a first-aid kit into the basin, then his trench coat descends to the floor; under the fluorescent light, we get a better look at him. He turns his back to the mirror, revealing two horrifically open lacerations running between both shoulder blades. He threads a needle, not with thread but with fishing wire, and begins to stitch the wounds closed as blood pools on the cement floor around his feet. Trench coat and shirt back on, Michael speeds along endless racks of guns, searching for just the right armaments, his every movement precise as if he's trained his whole life for this. Weapon after savage weapon gets tossed into rifle bags. Rifle bags filled, Michael heads for the exit. The place is secured tight, with a metal gate over the front doors and bars over the windows. Two officers, world weary, cruise through downtown. Burton stares out at the city's rain-soaked inhabitants with a deep loathing for the shadows looming in doorways and the streetwalkers. He holds his finger up like a pistol, aiming it at the people they pass, picking them off one by one. In the distance, the pop-pop of gunfire is heard. The police radio crackles with urgent chatter and numerous voices talking at once as Michael lets the gun bags hit the ground. Slowly, Michael places his palms on his cranium.

test_cases.description: A dark shape was seen in the reflection, growing and coming down fast, as a dark figure in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement, hands out to slow the impact. After a moment, his feet are climbed to by him, recovering from what seems to have been quite a fall. Chiseled features, a shaved head, and deep-set eyes are had by him. His surroundings are quickly checked by him, seeing nothing but brick walls above him. Then the rain is hammered down, and the overcoat is pulled tight around his body by Michael, as the mouth of the alley is dashed toward. The street is reached by him just in time to see a fleet of police cars tearing around the corner, sirens wailing, heading his way. The edge of it is run along by his finger. The overcoat begins to be peeled off by Michael, revealing his bare chest underneath, which dark tattoos cover. As the coat is fallen to the ground by him, we drift over to the brick wall behind him where Michael's shadow is seen crouching over. The rain is pounded harder, seemingly as punishment from the heavens. The glint of a knife comes down fast, and then silence. His trench coat is put back on by Michael, his face tight with pain, steps out of the alley, and a dark storefront across the street is stared at with determination by him. SMASH! Michael drops down through one of the skylights in a shower of glass and bursts in. Into the sink, a first-aid kit is tossed by him, then his trench coat falls to the floor; under the fluorescent light, a better look at him is gotten. He turns his back to the mirror, revealing two horrifically open wounds running between both shoulder blades. A needle is threaded by him, not with thread but with fishing wire, and the wounds are begun to be stitched closed as blood pools on the cement floor around his feet. Trench coat and shirt back on, along endless racks of guns, Michael races, searching for just the right weapons, his every movement precise as if he's trained his whole life for this. Weapon after ferocious weapon is tossed into rifle bags by him. Rifle bags filled, the exit is headed for by Michael. The place locks up tight, with a metal gate over the front doors and bars over the windows. Two cops, world weary, cruise through downtown. Burton stares out at the city's rain-soaked denizens with a deep hatred for the shadows looming in doorways and the streetwalkers. His finger is held up by him like a pistol, aiming it at the people they pass, picking them off one by one. In the distance, the pop-pop of gunfire is heard. The police radio crackles with urgent chatter and many voices talking at once as the gun bags are let hit the ground by Michael. Slowly, his palms are placed on his skull by Michael.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A dark figure in a tattered trench coat crashes onto the pavement, hands breaking the fall. After a moment, he stands, recovering from the drop. With chiseled features, shaved head, and deep-set eyes, he surveys the brick walls around him. Rain begins pounding down. Michael tightens his coat and sprints toward the alley's mouth, reaching the street as police cars round the corner, sirens blaring. He runs a finger along the coat’s edge before removing it, exposing a tattoo-covered chest. As it hits the ground, Michael's shadow crouches behind him. The rain intensifies; a knife flashes—then silence. Grimacing, he puts his coat back on and steps into the street, eyes fixed on a dark storefront. SMASH! He crashes through a skylight in a shower of glass. Tossing a first-aid kit into the sink, coat discarded, we see him clearly under fluorescent light. Facing away from the mirror, he reveals two gaping wounds between his shoulders. Threading fishing wire through a needle, he stitches them shut as blood pools around him. Dressed again, Michael moves swiftly through rows of guns, selecting weapons with trained precision and filling rifle bags. Ready, he heads for the locked exit, barred and gated. Meanwhile, two weary cops drive downtown. Burton glares at rain-soaked pedestrians, miming a gun with his finger, pretending to shoot. Gunfire echoes in the distance. The police radio crackles with urgent voices as Michael drops the gun bags and slowly presses his palms to his head.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A dark figure in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement, hands out to slow the fall. He rises, revealing chiseled features, a shaved head, and deep-set eyes. Checking his surroundings, he sees only brick walls. Rain starts, and Michael tightens his coat, dashing toward the alley's mouth. He reaches the street as police cars approach, sirens wailing. Michael peels off his coat, revealing a tattooed chest. As his coat drops, a knife glints, and silence follows. Michael, pained, dons his coat, exits the alley, and stares at a dark storefront. SMASH! He drops through a skylight, tossing a first-aid kit into the sink. Under fluorescent light, he reveals two open wounds between his shoulder blades. He stitches them with fishing wire as blood pools. Coat and shirt back on, Michael searches racks of guns, tossing weapons into rifle bags. Bags filled, he heads for the exit, locked tight with a metal gate and barred windows. Two weary cops cruise downtown. Burton, hating the shadows and streetwalkers, mimics shooting them. Gunfire pops in the distance, and the police radio crackles with urgent chatter as Michael drops the gun bags and places his palms on his skull.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A dark, ominous shape, rapidly growing larger and descending with alarming speed, appears in the reflection. It manifests as a shadowy figure clad in a tattered trench coat, tumbling onto the hard pavement below, hands outstretched in a desperate attempt to slow the impact. After a brief moment of stillness, he manages to climb to his feet, recovering from what seems to have been quite a significant fall. His features are chiseled, his head is shaved, and his eyes are deep-set, giving him a striking appearance. He quickly surveys his surroundings, noticing nothing but the imposing brick walls towering above him. Suddenly, the rain begins to pour down with intensity, and Michael pulls his overcoat tightly around his body, dashing with urgency toward the mouth of the alley. He reaches the street just in time to witness a fleet of police cars tearing around the corner, their sirens wailing loudly, heading directly in his direction. He runs his finger along the edge of something unseen. Michael begins to peel off his overcoat, revealing his bare chest underneath, which is intricately covered with dark, swirling tattoos. As his coat falls to the ground, our focus shifts to the brick wall behind him, where we see Michael's shadow crouching over. The rain pounds down even harder, as if it were a punishment from the heavens above. The glint of a knife flashes down swiftly, and then there is silence. Michael, his face contorted with pain, puts his trench coat back on, steps out of the alley, and stares with unwavering determination at a dark storefront across the street. SMASH! Michael drops down through one of the skylights in a shower of shattered glass and bursts into the building. He tosses a first-aid kit into the sink, then lets his trench coat fall to the floor; under the harsh fluorescent light, we get a clearer look at him. He turns his back to the mirror, revealing two horrifically open wounds running between both shoulder blades. He threads a needle, not with ordinary thread but with sturdy fishing wire, and begins to stitch the wounds closed as blood pools on the cement floor around his feet. With his trench coat and shirt back on, Michael races along endless racks of guns, searching meticulously for just the right weapons, his every movement precise as if he's trained his whole life for this moment. Weapon after ferocious weapon gets tossed into rifle bags. Once the rifle bags are filled, Michael heads for the exit. The place is locked up tight, with a metal gate over the front doors and bars over the windows. Two cops, world-weary and jaded, cruise through downtown. Burton stares out at the city's rain-soaked denizens with a deep-seated hatred for the shadows looming in doorways and the streetwalkers. He holds his finger up like a pistol, aiming it at the people they pass, picking them off one by one in his mind. In the distance, the pop-pop of gunfire is heard. The police radio crackles with urgent chatter and many voices talking at once as Michael lets the gun bags hit the ground. Slowly, Michael places his palms on his skull, contemplating his next move.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A dark and ominous shape materializes in the reflection, rapidly enlarging and descending with alarming speed toward the ground. It takes the form of a shadowy figure enveloped in a tattered trench coat, spiraling downward onto the unforgiving hard pavement below, with hands outstretched in a desperate and futile attempt to decelerate the harsh impact. After a brief, motionless pause, he manages to clamber to his feet, recovering from what appears to have been a rather significant and potentially dangerous fall. His features are sharply chiseled; his head is cleanly shaved, and his eyes are deeply set, giving him an arrestingly striking and memorable appearance. Quickly, he surveys the environment around him, noticing nothing but the looming, imposing presence of the brick walls towering above. Suddenly, the sky opens up, and rain begins to pour down with relentless intensity. Michael, reacting swiftly, pulls his overcoat tightly around his body for protection, and with a sense of urgency, he dashes toward the mouth of the narrow alley. Upon reaching the bustling street, he arrives just in time to witness a fleet of police vehicles careening around the corner, their sirens wailing loudly and unmistakably, heading directly in his direction. As he runs his finger along something unseen, Michael starts to peel off his overcoat, revealing his bare chest beneath, intricately adorned with dark, swirling tattoos that cover his skin. As his coat finds its way to the ground, our attention shifts to the brick wall behind him, where we see the shadow of Michael crouching ominously. The rain, relentless as ever, pounds down even harder, as if it were a punishment delivered by the heavens above. A knife glints in the light as it flashes down swiftly and then, there is silence. Contorting his face in pain, Michael places his trench coat back upon his shoulders, steps confidently out of the alley, and stares with unwavering determination at a dark storefront directly across the street. SMASH! Without hesitation, Michael drops down through one of the skylights in a swirling shower of shattered glass and bursts into the interior of the building. He throws a first-aid kit into the sink before allowing his trench coat to fall to the floor. Under the harsh, unyielding fluorescent light, we are afforded a clearer view of him. He turns his back to the mirror, revealing two horrifically open wounds running between both shoulder blades. He threads a needle, not with ordinary thread, but with sturdy, resilient fishing wire, and begins to stitch the wounds closed, with blood pooling on the cement floor around his feet. With his trench coat and shirt once more on his body, Michael races along endless racks filled with guns, meticulously searching for just the right weapons. Every movement he makes is precise, as if he’s been trained his entire life for this very moment. Weapon after ferocious weapon is tossed into the waiting rifle bags. Once the bags have been filled, Michael heads with determination toward the exit. The place is locked up tight, with a formidable metal gate over the front doors and sturdy bars over the windows. Meanwhile, two cops, world-weary and jaded, cruise through the downtown area. Burton watches the city's rain-soaked inhabitants with a deep-seated hatred for the ominous shadows that lurk in doorways and the streetwalkers who traverse the streets. Holding his finger up like a pistol, he aims it at the passersby, picking them off one by one in his mind's eye. In the distance, the distinct pop-pop of gunfire can be heard. The police radio crackles to life with urgent chatter, many voices converging at once, as Michael lets the gun bags drop to the ground. Slowly, with deliberate contemplation, Michael places his palms on his skull, pondering his next move.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A dark shape rapidly descends, growing larger in the reflection, as a dark figure clad in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement, extending his hands outward in an attempt to slow the impact of his fall. After a brief pause to gather himself, he climbs to his feet, recovering from what appears to have been a significant fall. His chiseled features, shaved head, and deep-set eyes become apparent as he quickly surveys his surroundings, noticing nothing but the imposing brick walls towering above him. Suddenly, the rain begins to pour down with intensity, prompting Michael to pull his overcoat tightly around his body as he dashes toward the mouth of the alley. He arrives at the street just in time to witness a fleet of police cars, sirens blaring, as they tear around the corner and head in his direction. Running his finger along the edge of his coat, Michael begins to peel it off, revealing his bare chest adorned with dark tattoos. As the coat slips to the ground, the scene shifts to the brick wall behind him, where Michael's shadow is seen crouching over. The rain intensifies, pounding harder as if in punishment from the heavens. A knife glints as it descends swiftly, followed by a sudden silence. With his face contorted in pain, Michael puts his trench coat back on, steps out of the alley, and fixes his gaze with determination on a dark storefront across the street. With a loud SMASH, Michael crashes through one of the skylights in a shower of glass, bursting into the building. He tosses a first-aid kit into the sink, and his trench coat falls to the floor, allowing a clearer view of him under the fluorescent light. Turning his back to the mirror, he reveals two horrifically open wounds running between his shoulder blades. He threads a needle, not with thread but with fishing wire, and begins to stitch the wounds closed as blood pools on the cement floor around his feet. Once his trench coat and shirt are back on, Michael races along endless racks of guns, meticulously searching for the right weapons, his every movement precise as if honed by a lifetime of training. Ferocious weapon after weapon is tossed into rifle bags until they are filled. With the bags in hand, Michael heads for the exit, only to find the place locked up tight, with a metal gate over the front doors and bars over the windows. Meanwhile, two world-weary cops cruise through downtown, with Burton staring out at the city's rain-soaked denizens, harboring a deep hatred for the shadows lurking in doorways and the streetwalkers. He raises his finger like a pistol, aiming it at the people they pass, pretending to pick them off one by one. In the distance, the pop-pop of gunfire echoes, and the police radio crackles with urgent chatter and a cacophony of voices. As Michael lets the gun bags hit the ground, he slowly places his palms on his skull.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
A dark figure in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement, quickly recovering from the fall. With chiseled features, a shaved head, and deep-set eyes, he surveys his surroundings, finding only brick walls above. As rain begins to pour, Michael tightens his overcoat and dashes toward the alley's mouth, reaching the street just as police cars with wailing sirens approach. He removes his overcoat, revealing a tattooed chest, and crouches against the brick wall. A knife glints in the rain, and after a moment of silence, Michael, pained but determined, dons his coat again and steps out to face a dark storefront across the street. 

He crashes through a skylight, landing amidst shattered glass, and tosses a first-aid kit into the sink. Under fluorescent light, he reveals two severe wounds between his shoulder blades, which he stitches with fishing wire as blood pools around him. Once dressed, Michael moves with precision through racks of guns, filling rifle bags with weapons as if trained for this moment. With the bags ready, he heads for the exit, finding the place securely locked with a metal gate and barred windows.

Meanwhile, two weary cops cruise downtown, one aiming a finger like a pistol at passersby. The distant sound of gunfire and urgent police radio chatter fill the air as Michael drops the gun bags and places his palms on his skull.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A dark shape, growing and coming down fast, appears in the reflection as a dark figure in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement, hands out to slow the impact, much like a seasoned parkour athlete navigating urban landscapes. After a moment, he climbs to his feet, recovering from what seems to have been quite a fall. He has chiseled features, a shaved head, and deep-set eyes that suggest a life spent in the shadows, evading recognition. He quickly checks his surroundings, seeing nothing but brick walls above him, reminiscent of the narrow, claustrophobic alleyways of Gotham City. Then the rain starts to hammer down like the torrential downpours typical of monsoon season, and Michael pulls his overcoat tight around his body, dashing toward the mouth of the alley, a familiar escape route. He reaches the street just in time to see a fleet of police cars tearing around the corner, sirens wailing with urgency akin to a five-alarm fire alert, heading his way. He runs his finger along its edge as a trace of anxiety crosses his face. Michael begins to peel off his overcoat, revealing his bare chest underneath, which is covered with dark tattoos, an intricate map of interlocking symbols and ancient script. As his coat falls to the ground, we drift over to the brick wall behind him where we see Michael's shadow crouch over, a silhouette of stealth. The rain pounds harder, seemingly as punishment from the heavens during a biblical storm. The glint of a knife comes down fast, a flash akin to a lightning strike, and then silence. Michael, his face tight with pain, puts his trench coat back on, steps out of the alley, and stares with determination at a dark storefront across the street. SMASH! Michael drops down through one of the skylights in a shower of glass, reminiscent of a high-stakes heist scene, and bursts in. He tosses a first-aid kit into the sink, then his trench coat falls to the floor; under the fluorescent light, which flickers as if in an abandoned warehouse, we get a better look at him. He turns his back to the mirror, revealing two horrifically open wounds running between both shoulder blades, wounds that suggest a fierce battle. He threads a needle, not with thread but with fishing wire, a method commonly used in survival scenarios, and begins to stitch the wounds closed as blood pools on the cement floor, a testament to his pain tolerance. Trench coat and shirt back on, Michael races along endless racks of guns, searching for just the right weapons, his every movement precise as if he's trained his whole life for this, like a weapon specialist in an elite task force. Weapon after ferocious weapon gets tossed into rifle bags designed for heavy-duty use. Rifle bags filled, Michael heads for the exit. The place is locked up tight, with a metal gate over the front doors and bars over the windows, a fortress-like security system. Two cops, world-weary from years of city patrol, cruise through downtown. Burton stares out at the city's rain-soaked denizens with a deep hatred for the shadows looming in doorways and the streetwalkers that are ever-present in the underbelly of metropolises. He holds his finger up like a pistol, aiming it at the people they pass, picking them off one by one like a jaded gunslinger. In the distance, the pop-pop of gunfire is heard, a sound that echoes through the urban night. The police radio crackles with urgent chatter and many voices talking at once, reminiscent of a dispatch center overwhelmed by chaos, as Michael lets the gun bags hit the ground. Slowly, Michael places his palms on his skull, a gesture of resignation.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. then his trench coat falls to the floor under the fluorescent light. we get a better look at him. He turns his back to the mirror revealing two horrifically open wounds running between both shoulder blades. He threads a needle not with thread but with fishing wire and begins to stitch the wounds closed as blood pools on the cement floor around his feet. Trench coat and shirt back on. Michael races along endless racks of guns searching for just the right weapons his every movement precise as if he is trained his whole life for this. Weapon after ferocious weapon gets tossed into rifle bags. Rifle bags filled Michael heads for the exit. The place is locked up tight with a metal gate over the front doors and bars over the windows. Two cops world weary cruise through downtown. Burton stares out at the city's rainsoaked denizens with a deep hatred for the shadows looming in doorways and the streetwalkers. He holds his finger up like a pistol aiming it at the people they pass picking them off one by one. In the distance the poppop of gunfire is heard. The police radio crackles with urgent chatter and many voices talking at once as Michael let us the gun bags hit the ground. Slowly Michael places his palms on his skull.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: A dark shape growing and coming down fast appears in the reflection as a dark figure in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement hands out to slow the impact. After a moment he climbs to his feet recovering from what seems to have been quite a fall. He has chiseled features a shaved head and deepset eyes. He quickly checks his surroundings seeing nothing but brick walls above him. Then the rain starts to hammer down and Michael pulls his overcoat tight around his body dashing toward the mouth of the alley. He reaches the street just in time to see a fleet of police cars tearing around the corner sirens wailing heading his way. He runs his finger along its edge. Michael begins to peel off his overcoat revealing his bare chest underneath which is covered with dark tattoos. The place is locked up tight with a metal gate over the front doors and bars over the windows. Two cops world weary cruise through downtown. Burton stares out at the city's rainsoaked denizens with a deep hatred for the shadows looming in doorways and the streetwalkers. He holds his finger up like a pistol aiming it at the people they pass picking them off one by one. In the distance the poppop of gunfire is heard. The police radio crackles with urgent chatter and many voices talking at once as Michael let us the gun bags hit the ground. Slowly Michael places his palms on his skull.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: A dark shape growing and coming down fast appears in the reflection as a dark figure in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement hands out to slow the impact. After a moment he climbs to his feet recovering from what seems to have been quite a fall. He has chiseled features a shaved head and deepset eyes. In the distance the poppop of gunfire is heard. The police radio crackles with urgent chatter and many voices talking at once as Michael let us the gun bags hit the ground. Slowly Michael places his palms on his skull.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A bright bird, soaring and rising up slowly, manifests in the mirage as a bright animal in a pristine lab coat leaps onto the meadow, wings out to increase the glide. After a second, it glides to its perch, rejuvenating from what seems to have been quite a rise. It has delicate scales, a feathered tail, and luminescent eyes. It quickly surveys its environment, seeing nothing but bamboo stalks below it. Then the fog starts to gather in, and Carlos wraps his satchel loose around his wings, leaping toward the peak of the mountain. He reaches the summit just in time to see a convoy of school buses coasting around the bend, horns blaring, rolling his way. He brushes his claw along its ridge. Carlos begins to shrug off his satchel, revealing his covered feet beneath, which are hidden with bright laces. As his satchel lands to the earth, we hover over to the bamboo stalk beside him where we see Carlos's silhouette float above. The fog swirls denser, seemingly as a blessing from the earth. The sparkle of a star rises up slowly, and then noise. Carlos, his face soft with delight, picks his satchel back up, slides out of the mountain, and gazes with curiosity at a bright gallery across the road. POP! Carlos rises up through one of the vents in a flurry of feathers and glides out. He slides a book of poems into the fountain, then his satchel lands on the grass; under the moonlight, we get a clearer view of it. He turns his back to the painting, revealing two spectacularly vivid drawings etched between both elbows. He threads a vine, not with fabric but with spider silk, and begins to weave the drawings together as dew collects on the stone floor around his claws. Satchel and shoes back off, Carlos glides across endless rows of plants, examining for just the right foliage, his every gesture fluid as if he's practiced his entire life for this. Foliage after gentle foliage gets slipped into tote bags. Tote bags stuffed, Carlos glides for the entrance. The space is opened wide, with a glass ceiling over the rear walls and curtains over the paintings. Two wolves, weary from the forest, prowl through the savanna. Dexter gazes out at the jungle's misty inhabitants with a deep longing for the dusk lurking in clearings and the wanderers. He raises his paw like a lantern, guiding it at the creatures they approach, marking them one by one. In the foreground, the clink-clink of chimes is perceived. The animal whistle hums with gentle harmony and few tones blending at once as Carlos lets the tote bags touch the water. Gradually, Carlos places his wings on his heart.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A dark figure in a tattered trench coat crashes onto the pavement and rises, revealing chiseled features and a tattooed chest as rain pours down. Michael, the protagonist, sees police cars approaching and runs, contemplating a task at hand. He breaks into a dark storefront, tending to severe wounds on his back with fishing wire. After retrieving an arsenal of weapons, he prepares for a confrontation, indicating a life of training. Meanwhile, two cynical cops, including Burton, patrol the rain-soaked city, disdainful of its inhabitants. Gunfire erupts in the distance amid chaotic police radio chatter, as Michael drops his weapon bags and places his hands on his head.
